alert.note: Alert for Cook (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 29 at 12:01AM CDT until July 29 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN COOK COUNTY... At 1201 AM CDT, doppler radar indicated that rainfall rates had diminished across the area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Ponded water will be slow to recede as light rainfall continues. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, streets, underpasses, low-lying areas, and other poor drainage areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chicago, Cicero, Hammond, Evanston, Skokie, Des Plaines, Oak Lawn, Berwyn, Mount Prospect, Oak Park, Glenview, Ohare Airport, Wheeling, Park Ridge, Northbrook, Niles, Austin, South Lawndale, Irving Park and West Town. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Warning means rapid-onset flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along creeks, drainage ditches, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
